Column Comment.0: PRODUCTION ENTITY SUBTYPE: the type of production entity may be equal to oneof the table names of the PDEN subtype tables, such as PDEN_WELL,PDEN_COUNTY or PDEN_FIELD. Validated by check constraint.
Column Comment.1: PRODUCTION ENTITY IDENTIFIER: An identifier that is unique within a specificproduction entity source and type.
Column Comment.2: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.3: PRODUCT TYPE: A reference table identifying the type of product (fluid) such asGAS, OIL, WATER, NGL, etc. Includes the less common products like STEAM,METHANE, BUTANE, HELIUM, etc.
Column Comment.4: CASE ID: A model of proposed production for a production entity. A forecast may becomprised of one or more segments and one or more fluids or fluid ratios.
Column Comment.5: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.6: AREA SIZE: the total area of the area for which reserves are to be calculated.
Column Comment.7: ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE: Original unit of measure for a value.
Column Comment.8: CASE NAME: full or long name given to the case study.
Column Comment.9: DATE FORMAT DESCRIPTION: Use this column to define the level of precision inthe DATE format colums, such as YYYY, or YYYQQ, or YYYYMM or YYYYMMDD
Column Comment.10: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.11: END DATE: End date for this decline segment.
Column Comment.12: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.13: GAS ABANDONMENT COMPRESSIBILITY: The abandonment compressibility factorused in the calculation of the reserves.
Column Comment.14: GAS ABANDONMENT PRESSURE: the abandonment pressure used in thecalculation of the reserves.
Column Comment.15: ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE: Original unit of measure for a value.
Column Comment.16: GAS INITIAL COMPRESSABILITY: The initial compressibilty factor.
Column Comment.17: INITIAL GAS PRESSURE: Initial or original gas pressure in the reservoir.
Column Comment.18: REMAINING GAS IN PLACE: the volume of gas that remains in place.
Column Comment.19: ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE: Original unit of measure for a value.
Column Comment.20: GAS ORIGINAL VOLUME IN PLACE: The original volume of gas in place.
Column Comment.21: ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE: Original unit of measure for a value.
Column Comment.22: GAS RATIO BGI: the gas formation volume factor.
Column Comment.23: GAS RECOVERY FACTOR: The percent recovery factor given to the gas.
Column Comment.24: GROSS NET PAY RATIO: The ratio of gross pay to net pay.
Column Comment.26: ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE: Original unit of measure for a value.
Column Comment.27: INITIAL RESERVOIR TEMPERATURE: the initial temperature of the reservoir.
Column Comment.28: ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE: Original unit of measure for a value.
Column Comment.29: NET PAY: Cumulative reservoir rock capable of producting within the entire thicknessof a pay zone.
Column Comment.30: ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE: Original unit of measure for a value.
Column Comment.31: REMAINING RECOVERABLE OIL IN PLACE: Recoverable oil in place calculated byoriginal oil in place x oil total recovery factor/100.
Column Comment.32: ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE: Original unit of measure for a value.
Column Comment.33: OIL ORIGINAL IN PLACE VOLUME: Original oil in place calculated as volume xporosity x oil shrinkage x (1-SW).
Column Comment.34: ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE: Original unit of measure for a value.
Column Comment.35: OIL RECOVERY FACTOR PRIMARY: The primary recovery factor as a percent.
Column Comment.36: OIL RECOVERY FACTOR SECONDARY: the secondary recovery factor for the oildescribed as a percent.
Column Comment.37: TOTAL OIL RECOVERY FACTOR: the total oil recovery factor percent, as a total ofthe primary and secondary recovery factors. This is a computed value and should bemanaged by trigger or procedure if possible.
Column Comment.38: RESIDUAL OIL SATURATION: The residual oil saturation.
Column Comment.39: OIL SHRINKAGE: Also define as 1.FVF (Formation Volume Factor) or 1/BoasSTm3/Rm3.
Column Comment.40: ORIGINAL GAS OIL RATIO: the original gas - oil ratio for this production entity.
Column Comment.41: ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE: Original unit of measure for a value.
Column Comment.42: ORIGINAL SOLUTION GAS IN PLACE: the original solution gas in place for thisPDEN.
Column Comment.43: ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE: Original unit of measure for a value.
Column Comment.44: PERMEABILTY: The ability or measurement of a rocks ability to transmit fluids.
Column Comment.46: POROSITY: Volume or pore space in the reservoir with a capacity for storing fluidsas a percent.
Column Comment.47: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should becreated.
Column Comment.48: PROJECT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a project that has resulted in thecreation of a decline analysis and forecast.
Column Comment.49: RECOVERABLE GAS OIL RATIO: the recoverable gas oil ratio.
Column Comment.50: RECOVERABLE SOLUTION GAS IN PLACE: the recoverable solution gas in place.
Column Comment.51: ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE: Original unit of measure for a value.
Column Comment.52: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.53: SOLUTION GAS RECOVERY FACTOR: the solution gas recovery factor.
Column Comment.54: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.55: START DATE: Start date for this decline segment.
Column Comment.56: VOLUME: total volume of the reservoir rock calculated by multiplying the area andthe net pay.
Column Comment.57: ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE: Original unit of measure for a value.
Column Comment.59: WATER SATURATION: Water saturation in the pore space as a percent.
Column Comment.60: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.61: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.62: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.63: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.64: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.65: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.66: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
